| HistoryText             = These test subjects were created by the [[Bartol Utler (Earth-616)|Butler]], who had found a way to monetize his research and used Deadpool's healing factor to fuse mutant genes from several X-Men onto North Korean prisoners to be used as superweapons for [[North Korea]].{{r|Deadpool Vol 5 16}}

[[File:North Korean Deadpool-X-Men Mutates (Earth-616) 001.png|thumb|left]]
With the help of [[Kim (North Korean Mutate) (Earth-616)|Kim the Nightcrawler]], [[Wade Wilson (Earth-616)|Deadpool]] freed the mutates{{r|Deadpool Vol 5 17}} and fought along with them against the North Korean army in order to rescue their families. Later, [[Steven Rogers (Earth-616)|Captain America]] helped orient to get to China.{{r|Deadpool Vol 5 18}}

After the health of the mutates worsened, Deadpool informed the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]] about them, who to let them stay at the [[Jean Grey School]], were they could be treated.{{r|Deadpool Vol 5 36}} However, they were hunted down in the [[Danger Room]] by the [[X-Men (Earth-616)|X-Men]], recently turned evil by an inversion spell, and were helped by the as-well-reversed Deadpool, now going as Zenpool.{{r|Deadpool Vol 5 37}} They found a new home in the [[Monster Metropolis]], the subterranean kingdom of Deadpool's wife [[Shiklah (Earth-616)|Shiklah]],{{r|Deadpool Vol 5 38}} where they could be treated for their health.{{r|Deadpool Vol 5 39}}
